science module¶

class science.OnboardProcessingModule(parent_module: Module, sd: list)[source]¶

Bases: Module

async activate()[source]¶

Initiates any thread-sensitive or envent-loop sensitive variables to be used in this module.

add_data_product(sd, lat, lon, time, product_type, filename, data)[source]¶

This function adds a data product to the science database (sd) and generates a .txt header file to represent the data product.

check_altimetry_outlier(item)[source]¶

Checks an altimetry measurement for outliers. Currently hardcoded. TODO use actual flood thresholding

compute_altimetry()[source]¶

Generates random altimetry data until we have an altimetry data source.

compute_chlorophyll_obs_value(b4, b5)[source]¶

Computes chlorophyll concentration using the 2BDA algorithm.

compute_tss_obs_value(b4)[source]¶

Computes TSS from the paper that Molly sent me TODO add reference

async coroutines()[source]¶

Generic routine to be performed by module. May be modified to perform other coroutines. Must not return unless an exception is raised. If method returns or raises an unhandled exception, this module and its parent module will terminate.

get_flood_chance(lat, lon, points)[source]¶

Gets the flood chance from the csv file

async internal_message_handler(msg)[source]¶

Handles message intended for this module and performs actions accordingly.

async process_meas_results()[source]¶

This function gets measurement results in the form of DataMessages from the engineering module and saves them in the onboard database

async save_observations()[source]¶

This function saves the lat/lon/time of all observations and all outlier observations for analysis.

store_raw_measurement(dataprod, lat, lon, obs_process_time)[source]¶

This function stores the raw data from a DataMessage prior to any preprocessing. It stores the raw message as a CSV identified by the lat, lon and time of the observation.

class science.ScienceReasoningModule(parent_module, sd)[source]¶

Bases: Module

async activate()[source]¶

Initiates any thread-sensitive or envent-loop sensitive variables to be used in this module.

check_altimetry_outliers(item)[source]¶

Checks altimetry data for outliers. Currently hardcoded. TODO update to use actual data source.

async check_sd()[source]¶

Checks the science database for the presence of outliers. Currently Scenario 1 only checks altimetry data for outliers.

check_tss_outliers(item)[source]¶

Checks the TSS data for outliers. Currently based on GEE script that pulled historical chlorophyll data.

async coroutines()[source]¶

Generic routine to be performed by module. May be modified to perform other coroutines. Must not return unless an exception is raised. If method returns or raises an unhandled exception, this module and its parent module will terminate.

get_flood_chance(lat, lon, points)[source]¶

Gets the flood chance from the csv file

get_mean_sd(lat, lon, points)[source]¶

Gets the mean and standard deviation from the CSV data

get_pixel_value_from_image(image, lat, lon, resolution)[source]¶

Checks the image for the value of a specific pixel given by lat/lon inputs. Currently hardcoded for 30m landsat imagery.

Bases: Module

Checks TSS data for outliers. Currently hardcoded. TODO use real data source.

compute_science_value(lat, lon, obs)[source]¶

Computes science value of a particular observation. Currently 10 for outliers, 1 for anything else.

Executes list of coroutine tasks to be executed by the science value module. These coroutine task incluide:

get_data_product(lat, lon, product_type)[source]¶

Gets data product from science database based on latitude, longitude and product type. TODO add time as a parameter.

Gets flood chance from CSV data.
